item.title: How I reduced the size of a Docker image
item.description: December 2017, at work, I had to deploy a micro-service very very quickly to support the core service of ours. The framework I used for this one was Sanic, (a micro-framework written in Python 3.5 with Async support). So, I get the python image first along with dependencies in a requirements.txt file. This is how it went: FROMpython:3.6ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED 1ENV TZ=Asia/DhakaRUN ln -snf /usr/share/zoneinfo/$TZ /etc/localtime && echo $TZ > /etc/timezoneRUN mkdir /appADD requirements.
